Key Match Events: The Warriors went big and started slow, falling down 12-3, but the game swung rapidly.
The Warriors won the middle quarters by 27 points, led by as many as 37 points and cruised to a runaway 139-104 season-opening win.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr knew two uncomfortable conversations awaited him before the regular season about trimming the rotation.
Kerr chose a different path and deployed a 12-man rotation against the Portland Trail Blazers.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr said he will keep the Warriors in a 12-man rotation moving forward.
Curry said, 'It's the identity of this team right now. We can rely on our depth, ability to be versatile depending on what the game calls for.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors operated up-tempo and maintained a high volume from 3 (48 attempts).
Buddy Hield scored 22 points in only 15 minutes off the bench, making five of his seven 3s and hustling around for five rebounds.
Others: Jonathan Kuminga’s stakes are the easiest to identify as he didn’t agree to an extension this week, and his financial future is still up in the air.
Injuries will inevitably chip away at Kerr’s wide variety of options, simplifying his choices.
